oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Felix De Weldon and Mrs. Alvin York at the York Memorial

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Monuments & memorials; Spouses; Sculpture; Capitols; Equestrian statues; Cannons
York, Alvin Cullum, 1887-1964; World War, 1914-1918 -- Tennessee -- History; Nashville (Tenn.); De Weldon, Felix, 1907-2003
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The statue of Alvin York on the Tennessee State Capitol grounds. The statue's sculptor, Felix De Weldon, and York's widow, Gracie, are photographed viewing the statue. The Tennessee State Capitol building, a cannon, and the equestrian statue of Andrew Jackson can be seen in the background.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Wilbur Lawson, Department of Education
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The statue honoring Alvin York was sculpted by Felix De Weldon, who also created the famous Iwo Jima monument in Washington D.C. The statue was installed in 1968 on the Capitol grounds in Nashville, Tennessee.
